meanings.definition: Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society (王立地理学会フェロー)
meanings.english_definition: A person who has been elected a Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society.

examples.sentence: He proudly added FRGS after his name.
examples.translation: 彼は誇らしげに名前の後にFRGSと付け加えた。

etymology.value: An abbreviation of Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society.

usage_notes.explanation: FRGS is an honorific title granted by the Royal Geographical Society to individuals who have made significant contributions to geography.

readability_explanation.text: FRGS is a post-nominal title indicating fellowship in the Royal Geographical Society. It is typically used by academics, researchers, and professionals in geography. Understanding this term requires familiarity with academic and professional qualifications.

example_sentences.sentence: As an FRGS, she contributed significantly to the field of cartography.
example_sentences.translation: FRGSとして、彼女は地図製作の分野に大きく貢献した。
example_sentences.meaning_category: Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society
